postBodyContent: @ porn blogs who keep following me

Based on the sun signs of people I’ve known.

Aries: squinting into the sunlight, caught between a smile and a scowl, a hand trying to shade their eyes and the other hand on their hip, feet wide

Taurus: kneeling with their hands digging into wet dark earth, not mud but damp loose soft soil, gently lifting a cupped handsful and letting it run through their fingers, inside a canopy of leaves with the sunflight glowing warm behind them

Gemini: sitting on the porch steps, leaning against their knees, biting their lip while grinning, looking up at the sky, arms folded between their knees and their chest with their fingers tapping their collarbones

Cancer: at the edge of a country road at sunset, looking across a field of blowing grasses and wildflowers, facing the sunset instead of facing you, their shoulders square, something peaceful in the line of their back

Leo: standing still with the setting sun behind them, haloing them in glowing gold, arms folded or at their sides but either way very still and calm and assured, the kind of hardness that isn’t harsh but rather is something you can rely on

Virgo: sitting back on a couch that’s covered in blankets over the back of the cushions, semi-reclined with their head resting against one hand, glancing away from you with a smirk, one foot crossed under the opposite knee

Libra: in mid-run, half-turning to look behind them with a grin that gives off sparks, legs light and active, they almost look suspended in the air, the sunlight makes their eyes sparkle and you want to run with them

Scorpio: lying back in dark water, yellow leaves float on the water, eyes closed peacefully but when they open them to look at you their gaze is piercing, their face/shoulders/upper chest are out of the water and bare, their hands might be lifted palms-up out of the water

Sagittarius: standing next to a bonfire, almost laughing and peering up at you with a smirk, face and hair aglow from the fire, with their weight on one foot and their arms folded comfortably

Capricorn: sitting at the end of their bed in the dim bedroom, the objects of their day laid on the bed behind them, their clothes and contents of their bag and wallet, sitting quietly in the space between one task and the next

Aquarius: in the snow, eyes glittering like the snowflakes around them, hands in their pockets and back straight, caught mid-stride, turning their head to look at you over their shoulder

Pisces: standing in a meadow at sunrise, eyes wide and lips curled into the softest smile, with bunches of tiny flowers in their hands which they’re holding up and out to you, peering up at you, seeming partly apprehensive and partly like the know something you don’t

if they didn’t escape, if he didn’t protect the girls, the story had not begun.

That’s why I love this trio (tears…)
Clemence Poesy photographed by Koto Bolofo for Harper’s Bazaar UK - December 2015
